name: places/ChIJhzyJPHVZwokRkzipsn_c5zw
adrFormatAddress: 313 1st Ave., New York, NY 10003, USA

originalText.text:
I’m taking the time to write about an outstanding employee that is directly responsible for maintaining me as a top-tier customer which I have been for 33+ years and even longer on my Verizon wireless phone service. I have always shop at this location when she was in her old location at 3rd Ave and now at 1st Ave.
This time beside all the great service I had over the time same great customer service I had in recent days. As i had broken my device and dealing with asurion was a nightmare had Aarti the sale Rep had not help me get though it.
Always helping nature giving customer priority and to go an extra mile to accomplish which is rare and uncommon in currect sales profession. I always recommend people to shop here.

originalText.text:
I recently got a new phone upgraded from this Verizon store. What a good experience dealing with the sales person., very positive attitude. Data transfer from my broken phone was impossible but she got everything completely moved over to the new device.
After couple of days my new phone was lost visiting my friend I got panicked ran to the store as I had unsuccessful attempts in finding the phone but the very Rep helped me locate the device via Find My app. I am so glad that such a Tech/sales person exist in my neighborhood.
Great customer service friendly store.

originalText.text: I walked in to the Verizon store not expecting much. Aarli was there alone and i rolled my eyes thinking what a waste .  I was pleasantly surprised to find i was given all the time patience and help that i needed.  Sometimes its difficult to get the service you need with a disability so i say thank you verizon for hiring such a thoughtful bright caring person

originalText.text: Whoever was working the front desk this morning was so rude. I went to return my Verizon modem and she started talking to me like I was an idiot, saying this location doesn’t take modem returns and it’s “obviously the stores with all the boxes, wires and cables” (? how would I know that). I went to leave and said I would figure it out myself and she goes “oh my god you have such a sour attitude” after being nothing but condescending the moment I stepped through the door. It’s way too hot out to be such a jerk at 10 am. I wonder if she bought her attitude at the other store location she was telling me about.

originalText.text: Genuinely the worst customer service I've had. The lady working there with glasses was terribly rude and cut me off every time I tried to speak to her. She then refused to answer any of my basic questions about upgrading my phone. I've usually had great experiences with Verizon customer service and will definitely not be returning after this one
